Articles.Content:
Chillin in his rover on the mun, taking a break after 6 missions straight.

Bill and Bob took over to Duna.
He's stuck on the mun with some goo. Had enough fuel to get him there...just not enough to get him back. He brought a sleeping bag though, so it's okay.

My Jeb was sent out on the first mission to Jool. He handed his craft on Laythe, and Bop, and flew by vall and tylo His craft has racked up a tremendous amount of science but it doesn't have quite enough gas to get home. I've been letting it sit in a solar orbit, and every time it can encounter Jool I try to make it slingshot me closer to kerbin. So far I'm not there yet, but I at least got a Duna flyby.
Still aerobraking around Kerbin, out of fuel.

Still aerobraking around Kerbin, out of fuel.

Same here. My Jeb is currently in a nasty 60*5000km orbit around Kerbin after returning from Duna and running out of fuel.

He's been in his Mk1 lander for over 700 days now, and he will be there for a good deal more until his orbit decays enough for him to de-orbit.

Edit: Slowly but surely his orbit decays. Currently at 57*2500

Edited October 19, 2013 by Tex_NL

My Jeb is stuck in LKO, just couple of meters from his capsule He can't get back, because every time i try to grab the ladder he enters rag-doll mode and is pushed away. Now he's running low on jetpack fuel, so i started planning rescue mission.
Jebediah is currently on Ike, with 1.2 units of fuel. Happily doing science between hybernation naps. Awaiting rescue, perhaps.

My Jeb is stuck in LKO, just couple of meters from his capsule He can't get back, because every time i try to grab the ladder he enters rag-doll mode and is pushed away. Now he's running low on jetpack fuel, so i started planning rescue mission.

Try switching camera views with [V]. Your EVA Kerbal orientates himself with your camera. A different view might align him better enabling him to grab the ladder.
At the bottom of a slight dent in the launchpad after a failed launch. One that he never survived
Testing my new supersonic jetpack.
Stuck in his capsule beneath KSC2. Parachute derped over the KSC 2.
currently on the way to duna and ike

He, uh... He was going to go to the Mun, but I overshot a little and now he's orbiting the Sun with an aopasis equal to that of Kerbin and a periapsis of about 5 million meters. I EVA'ed him when his ship (Slightly modified Kerbal X) ran out of fuel. I time warped to see how long it would take him to hit a planet, but he's been up there for 263 days and still happy as ever.

PS: When he started orbiting the Sun I made no rescue attempt, I immediately started trying to launch him into the sun.
Last time I saw him he was heading towards the Munar surface with something like 250 M/S. with an empty lander...

After 3 suborbital flights, 5 orbital flights and a hell of a lot of accidents with SRB's, lack of control over the rocket and crashing to sea and mountains in incredible ways... He's alive (for now).

Preparing for a mission to the MÃƒÂ¼n (only transfer) as a first phase before going in orbit and landing.

Jebediah(making some tests with the new equipment)
Well he is currently tucked safely imto the crew plex. And only flys designs that are safe. =^.^=

I guess youve never looked close at jebbadiah kerman during close explosions. He has a secret fear of explosions. Any who, Jebbadiah is currently sitting back at the Astonaut Complex with the other 6 Kerbonauts discussing their missions. Jeb seems like the bane of mine if I put him on a flight it is never successful.
right now is in a LKO mission to dock with another identical ship, and perform some EVA's with his buddy up there, he will be back quite soon for another more important mission

Has anyone ever thought of putting dear Jeb into a rocket and leaving the known Solar System?

Sure .... it would be a one way trip.... but oh... the adventures he could have.....

Which one?

First died in the Demo.

Second is in orbit.

Third is safe on Kerbin after two successful missions.

Fourth is stuck in Munar orbit.

Fifth is in LKO, frozen and dead, forever orbiting 190kms above his home.

Sixth, Seventh and Eighth are back safe on Kerbin after countless successful missions.

Ninth is stuck on Duna.

Tenth just landed a simple, start-part rocket on top of the VAB.
Doing some science! On the mun with roughly 9.67 units of fuel left.

Sandbox save: Testing the new Crew Transport System (a multifunctional rocket system for getting up to 7 Kerbals anywhere in the Kerbin system).

Career save: Aboard the Grasshopper 4 in LKO, waiting for transfer to the Mun (and hopefully landing and return, it's a big rocket for a small pod^^)
Getting some rest on Kerbin's beaches after his first Minmus mission. For the time being, Bill is in charge of collecting SCIENCE! from the rest of Mun's craters
Orbiting the Mun, waiting for someone to pick him up... and so is Bob
On Dres, heading towards its equatorial canyon in an Ant. Bob is keeping him company.
